title: Bug 124610 - Add a filter on a boolean computed column will cause error.
OB: Add a filter on a boolean computed column should not cause an error.
EB: When adding a filter on a boolean computed column and saving and previewing, an error occurs.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new BIRT sample data source and a dataset from the table 'orders'.
2. Create a computed column with the name 'yes/no', type 'any' (not boolean), and value 'if(row[1]%2==0){true;}else{false;}'.
3. Drag the dataset from the Data Explorer to the Layout.
4. Select the table and click on the 'Filters' tab in the Property Editor.
5. Click the 'Add' button.
6. Select 'yes/no' as the Expression and 'Is True' as the Operator.
7. Save and preview the report.

Expected result: The filter should work without causing any error.
Actual result: An error occurs: 'data.engine.ConvertToDataTypeError org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.core.DataException: Cannot convert the value to class java.lang.Boolean.'
